Dominant colors.white: Approx. 10% (secondary text color, and diagram background)

Composition type: Medium close-up (photo of a woman, head and shoulders)
Text-dominant layout (large block of text taking up left two-thirds)

Human presence.demographics: Adult female, likely of South Asian descent

Main objects/props featured: Medical illustration (female pelvic region and organs)
Background environment: Neutral blurred background behind woman's portrait (suggestive of indoor setting)

TEXT ELEMENTS.visible_text: PID बच्चेदानी में इन्फेक्शन कारण, लक्षण और इलाज

font_characteristics.emphasis: Strong emphasis (all caps for 'PID'; increased font weight and size for main section headers)

text_placement_within_frame: 'PID' is top center-left, largest, in yellow on blue box
Main Hindi text is below, in yellow and white, filling most of left two-thirds
Text occupies majority of the left side; right side reserved for image/diagram/portrait

overall_emotional_tone: Supportive and reassuring (positive facial expression, direct text about solutions and care)
visual_metaphors_or_symbols: Medical illustration of uterus represents focus on gynecological health
Portrait of woman conveys trust and expertise
clickbait_techniques_employed: Bold use of all-caps and color for 'PID'
Direct mention of 'best treatment', 'symptoms', and 'causes' implying full answers in the video
Combination of text, human face, and anatomical image creates immediate relevance and urgency
brand_elements_present: None overtly—no logos or channel brand, but the use of a professional-like portrait and clear text creates an authoritative/educational perception

THUMBNAIL-TITLE RELATIONSHIP.visual_reinforcement: Thumbnail directly mirrors the title by displaying the term 'PID', its full Hindi description, and the main keyword components: infection, causes, symptoms, and treatment, along with visual symbols (medical diagram of pelvic region) that reinforce the specific health concern mentioned.
THUMBNAIL-TITLE RELATIONSHIP.contrasts_or_mismatches: No major mismatches; the thumbnail is aligned with the title, both visually and contextually. The only minor point is that the thumbnail is mostly in Hindi, while the video title includes English—may affect international reach.
